instructions.name: depositGoverningTokens
docs: Deposits governing tokens (Community or Council) to Governance Realm and establishes your voter weight to be used for voting within the Realm
Note: If subsequent (top up) deposit is made and there are active votes for the Voter then the vote weights won't be updated automatically
It can be done by relinquishing votes on active Proposals and voting again with the new weight

docs: Governance Realm account

accounts.name: governingTokenHoldingAccount
docs: Governing Token Holding account. PDA seeds: ['governance',realm, governing_token_mint]

accounts.name: governingTokenSourceAccount
docs: Governing Token Source account. All tokens from the account will be transferred to the Holding account

accounts.name: governingTokenTransferAuthority

accounts.name: tokenOwnerRecordAccount

accounts.name: splToken

accounts.name: sysvarRent
docs: Sysvar Rent

instructions.name: withdrawGoverningTokens
docs: Withdraws governing tokens (Community or Council) from Governance Realm and downgrades your voter weight within the Realm
Note: It's only possible to withdraw tokens if the Voter doesn't have any outstanding active votes
If there are any outstanding votes then they must be relinquished before tokens could be withdrawn

instructions.name: setGovernanceDelegate
docs: Sets Governance Delegate for the given Realm and Governing Token Mint (Community or Council)
The Delegate would have voting rights and could vote on behalf of the Governing Token Owner
The Delegate would also be able to create Proposals on behalf of the Governing Token Owner
Note: This doesn't take voting rights from the Token Owner who still can vote and change governance_delegate

accounts.name: currentGovernanceDelegateOrGoverning
docs: Current Governance Delegate or Governing Token owner

accounts.name: tokenOwnerRecord
docs: Token Owner  Record

instructions.name: insertTransaction
docs: Inserts Transaction with a set of instructions for the Proposal at the given index position
New Transaction must be inserted at the end of the range indicated by Proposal transactions_next_index
If a Transaction replaces an existing Transaction at a given index then the old one must be removed using RemoveTransaction first

instructions.name: signOffProposal
docs: Signs off Proposal indicating the Signatory approves the Proposal
When the last Signatory signs off the Proposal it enters Voting state
Note: Adding signatories to a Proposal is a quality and not a security gate and
it's entirely at the discretion of the Proposal owner
If Proposal owner doesn't designate any signatories then can sign off the Proposal themself

accounts.name: realmAccount
docs: Realm account

accounts.name: governanceAccount
docs: Governance account

accounts.name: proposalAccount
docs: Proposal account

accounts.name: signatoryAccount
docs: Signatory account signing off the Proposal
Or Proposal owner if the owner hasn't appointed any signatories

accounts.name: tokenOwnerRecordForProposal
docs: TokenOwnerRecord for the Proposal owner, required when the owner signs off the Proposal

instructions.name: castVote
docs: Uses your voter weight (deposited Community or Council tokens) to cast a vote on a Proposal
By doing so you indicate you approve or disapprove of running the Proposal set of transactions
If you tip the consensus then the transactions can begin to be run after their hold up time

docs: Realm account

accounts.name: governanceAccount

accounts.name: proposalVoteRecordAccount
docs: Proposal VoteRecord account. PDA seeds: ['governance',proposal,token_owner_record]

accounts.name: theGoverningTokenMintWhich
docs: The Governing Token Mint which is used to cast the vote (vote_governing_token_mint)
The voting token mint is the governing_token_mint of the Proposal for Approve, Deny and Abstain votes
For Veto vote the voting token mint is the mint of the opposite voting population
Council mint to veto Community proposals and Community mint to veto Council proposals
Note: In the current version only Council veto is supported

instructions.name: relinquishVote
docs: Relinquish Vote removes voter weight from a Proposal and removes it from voter's active votes
If the Proposal is still being voted on then the voter's weight won't count towards the vote outcome
If the Proposal is already in decided state then the instruction has no impact on the Proposal
and only allows voters to prune their outstanding votes in case they wanted to withdraw Governing tokens from the Realm

accounts.name: governanceAccount

accounts.name: theGoverningTokenMintWhich
docs: The Governing Token Mint which was used to cast the vote (vote_governing_token_mint)

accounts.name: optionalGovernanceAuthorityTokenOwner
docs: Optional Governance Authority (Token Owner or Governance Delegate)
It's required only when Proposal is still being voted on

accounts.name: optionalBeneficiaryAccount
docs: Optional Beneficiary account which would receive lamports when VoteRecord Account is disposed
It's required only when Proposal is still being voted on

instructions.name: executeTransaction
docs: Executes a Transaction in the Proposal
Anybody can execute transaction once Proposal has been voted Yes and transaction_hold_up time has passed
The actual transaction being executed will be signed by Governance PDA the Proposal belongs to
For example to execute Program upgrade the ProgramGovernance PDA would be used as the singer

accounts.name: governanceAccount
docs: Governance account

accounts.name: proposalAccount
docs: Proposal account

accounts.name: proposalTransactionAccount
docs: ProposalTransaction account you wish to execute
3+ Any extra accounts that are part of the transaction, in order

instructions.name: flagTransactionError
docs: Flags a transaction and its parent Proposal with error status
It can be used by Proposal owner in case the transaction is permanently broken and can't be executed
Note: This instruction is a workaround because currently it's not possible to catch errors from CPI calls
and the Governance program has no way to know when instruction failed and flag it automatically

accounts.name: GovernanceAccountType

variants.name: Uninitialized
docs: Default uninitialized account state

variants.name: RealmV1
docs: Top level aggregation for governances with Community Token (and optional Council Token)

variants.name: TokenOwnerRecordV1
docs: Token Owner Record for given governing token owner within a Realm

variants.name: GovernanceV1
docs: Governance account

variants.name: ProgramGovernanceV1
docs: Program Governance account

variants.name: ProposalV1
docs: Proposal account for Governance account. A single Governance account can have multiple Proposal accounts

variants.name: SignatoryRecordV1
docs: Proposal Signatory account

variants.name: VoteRecordV1
docs: Vote record account for a given Proposal.  Proposal can have 0..n voting records

variants.name: ProposalInstructionV1
docs: ProposalInstruction account which holds an instruction to execute for Proposal

variants.name: MintGovernanceV1
docs: Mint Governance account

variants.name: TokenGovernanceV1
docs: Token Governance account

variants.name: RealmConfig
docs: Realm config account (introduced in V2)

variants.name: VoteRecordV2
docs: Vote record account for a given Proposal.  Proposal can have 0..n voting records
V2 adds support for multi option votes

variants.name: ProposalTransactionV2
docs: ProposalTransaction account which holds instructions to execute for Proposal within a single Transaction
V2 replaces ProposalInstruction and adds index for proposal option and multiple instructions

variants.name: ProposalV2
docs: Proposal account for Governance account. A single Governance account can have multiple Proposal accounts
V2 adds support for multiple vote options

variants.name: ProgramMetadata
docs: Program metadata account (introduced in V2)
It stores information about the particular SPL-Governance program instance

variants.name: RealmV2
docs: Top level aggregation for governances with Community Token (and optional Council Token)
V2 adds the following fields:
1) use_community_voter_weight_addin and use_max_community_voter_weight_addin to RealmConfig
2) voting_proposal_count
3) extra reserved space reserved_v2

variants.name: TokenOwnerRecordV2
docs: Token Owner Record for given governing token owner within a Realm
V2 adds extra reserved space reserved_v2

variants.name: GovernanceV2
docs: Governance account
V2 adds extra reserved space reserved_v2

variants.name: ProgramGovernanceV2
docs: Program Governance account
V2 adds extra reserved space reserved_v2

variants.name: MintGovernanceV2
docs: Mint Governance account
V2 adds extra reserved space reserved_v2

variants.name: TokenGovernanceV2
docs: Token Governance account
V2 adds extra reserved space reserved_v2

variants.name: SignatoryRecordV2
docs: Proposal Signatory account
V2 adds extra reserved space reserved_v2
Defines all Governance accounts types

accounts.name: ProposalState

variants.name: Draft
docs: Draft - Proposal enters Draft state when it's created

variants.name: SigningOff
docs: SigningOff - The Proposal is being signed off by Signatories
Proposal enters the state when first Signatory Sings and leaves it when last Signatory signs

variants.name: Voting
docs: Taking votes

variants.name: Succeeded
docs: Voting ended with success

variants.name: Executing
docs: Voting on Proposal succeeded and now instructions are being executed
Proposal enter this state when first instruction is executed and leaves when the last instruction is executed

variants.name: Completed
docs: Completed

variants.name: Cancelled
docs: Cancelled

variants.name: Defeated
docs: Defeated

variants.name: ExecutingWithErrors
docs: Same as Executing but indicates some instructions failed to execute
Proposal can't be transitioned from ExecutingWithErrors to Completed state

variants.name: Vetoed
docs: The Proposal was vetoed
What state a Proposal is in

accounts.name: VoteTipping

variants.name: Strict
docs: Tip when there is no way for another option to win and the vote threshold
has been reached. This ignores voters withdrawing their votes.
Currently only supported for the "yes" option in single choice votes.

variants.name: Early
docs: Tip when an option reaches the vote threshold and has more vote weight
than any other options.
Currently only supported for the "yes" option in single choice votes.

variants.name: Disabled
docs: Never tip the vote early.
The type of vote tipping to use on a Proposal.
Vote tipping means that under some conditions voting will complete early.

accounts.name: TransactionExecutionStatus

variants.name: None
docs: Transaction was not executed yet

variants.name: Success
docs: Transaction was executed successfully

variants.name: Error
docs: Transaction execution failed
The status of instruction execution

accounts.name: InstructionExecutionFlags

variants.name: None
docs: No execution flags are specified
Instructions can be executed individually, in any order, as soon as they hold_up time expires

variants.name: Ordered
docs: Instructions are executed in a specific order
Note: Ordered execution is not supported in the current version
The implementation requires another account type to track deleted instructions

variants.name: UseTransaction
docs: Multiple instructions can be executed as a single transaction
Note: Transactions are not supported in the current version
The implementation requires another account type to group instructions within a transaction
Transaction execution flags defining how instructions are executed for a Proposal

accounts.name: GovernanceV2

fields.name: account_type
docs: Account type. It can be Uninitialized, Governance, ProgramGovernance, TokenGovernance or MintGovernance

fields.name: realm
docs: Governance Realm

fields.name: governed_account
docs: Account governed by this Governance and/or PDA identity seed
It can be Program account, Mint account, Token account or any other account
Note: The account doesn't have to exist. In that case the field is only a PDA seed
Note: Setting governed_account doesn't give any authority over the governed account
The relevant authorities for specific account types must still be transferred to the Governance PDA
Ex: mint_authority/freeze_authority for a Mint account
or upgrade_authority for a Program account should be transferred to the Governance PDA

fields.name: proposals_count
docs: Running count of proposals

fields.name: config
docs: Governance config

fields.name: reserved
docs: Reserved space for future versions

fields.name: voting_proposal_count
docs: The number of proposals in voting state in the Governance

fields.name: reserved_v2
docs: Reserved space for versions v2 and onwards
Note: This space won't be available to v1 accounts until runtime supports resizing
Governance Account

accounts.name: RealmV1

fields.name: account_type
docs: Governance account type

fields.name: community_mint
docs: Community mint

fields.name: config
docs: Configuration of the Realm

fields.name: reserved
docs: Reserved space for future versions

fields.name: voting_proposal_count
docs: The number of proposals in voting state in the Realm
Note: This is field introduced in V2 but it took space from reserved
and we have preserve it for V1 serialization roundtrip

fields.name: authority
docs: Realm authority. The authority must sign transactions which update the realm config
The authority should be transferred to Realm Governance to make the Realm self governed through proposals

fields.name: name
docs: Governance Realm name
Governance Realm Account
Account PDA seeds" ['governance', name]

accounts.name: TokenOwnerRecordV1

fields.name: account_type
docs: Governance account type

fields.name: realm
docs: The Realm the TokenOwnerRecord belongs to

fields.name: governing_token_mint
docs: Governing Token Mint the TokenOwnerRecord holds deposit for

fields.name: governing_token_owner
docs: The owner (either single or multisig) of the deposited governing SPL Tokens
This is who can authorize a withdrawal of the tokens

fields.name: governing_token_deposit_amount
docs: The amount of governing tokens deposited into the Realm
This amount is the voter weight used when voting on proposals

fields.name: unrelinquished_votes_count
docs: The number of votes cast by TokenOwner but not relinquished yet
Every time a vote is cast this number is increased and it's always decreased when relinquishing a vote regardless of the vote state

fields.name: total_votes_count
docs: The total number of votes cast by the TokenOwner
If TokenOwner withdraws vote while voting is still in progress total_votes_count is decreased  and the vote doesn't count towards the total

fields.name: outstanding_proposal_count
docs: The number of outstanding proposals the TokenOwner currently owns
The count is increased when TokenOwner creates a proposal
and decreased  once it's either voted on (Succeeded or Defeated) or Cancelled
By default it's restricted to 1 outstanding Proposal per token owner

fields.name: reserved
docs: Reserved space for future versions

fields.name: governance_delegate
docs: A single account that is allowed to operate governance with the deposited governing tokens
It can be delegated to by the governing_token_owner or current governance_delegate
Governance Token Owner Record
Account PDA seeds: ['governance', realm, token_mint, token_owner ]

accounts.name: GovernanceV1

fields.name: account_type
docs: Account type. It can be Uninitialized, Governance, ProgramGovernance, TokenGovernance or MintGovernance

fields.name: realm
docs: Governance Realm

fields.name: governed_account
docs: Account governed by this Governance and/or PDA identity seed
It can be Program account, Mint account, Token account or any other account
Note: The account doesn't have to exist. In that case the field is only a PDA seed
Note: Setting governed_account doesn't give any authority over the governed account
The relevant authorities for specific account types must still be transferred to the Governance PDA
Ex: mint_authority/freeze_authority for a Mint account
or upgrade_authority for a Program account should be transferred to the Governance PDA

fields.name: proposals_count
docs: Running count of proposals

fields.name: config
docs: Governance config

fields.name: reserved
docs: Reserved space for future versions

fields.name: voting_proposal_count
docs: The number of proposals in voting state in the Governance
Note: This is field introduced in V2 but it took space from reserved
and we have preserve it for V1 serialization roundtrip
Governance Account

accounts.name: ProposalV1

fields.name: account_type
docs: Governance account type

fields.name: governance
docs: Governance account the Proposal belongs to

fields.name: governing_token_mint
docs: Indicates which Governing Token is used to vote on the Proposal
Whether the general Community token owners or the Council tokens owners vote on this Proposal

fields.name: state
docs: Current proposal state

fields.name: token_owner_record
docs: The TokenOwnerRecord representing the user who created and owns this Proposal

fields.name: signatories_count
docs: The number of signatories assigned to the Proposal

fields.name: signatories_signed_off_count
docs: The number of signatories who already signed

fields.name: yes_votes_count
docs: The number of Yes votes

fields.name: no_votes_count
docs: The number of No votes

fields.name: instructions_executed_count
docs: The number of the instructions already executed

fields.name: instructions_count
docs: The number of instructions included in the proposal

fields.name: instructions_next_index
docs: The index of the the next instruction to be added

fields.name: draft_at
docs: When the Proposal was created and entered Draft state

fields.name: signing_off_at
docs: When Signatories started signing off the Proposal

fields.name: voting_at
docs: When the Proposal began voting as UnixTimestamp

fields.name: voting_at_slot
docs: When the Proposal began voting as Slot
Note: The slot is not currently used but the exact slot is going to be required to support snapshot based vote weights

fields.name: voting_completed_at
docs: When the Proposal ended voting and entered either Succeeded or Defeated

fields.name: executing_at
docs: When the Proposal entered Executing state

fields.name: closed_at
docs: When the Proposal entered final state Completed or Cancelled and was closed

fields.name: execution_flags
docs: Instruction execution flag for ordered and transactional instructions
Note: This field is not used in the current version

fields.name: max_vote_weight
docs: The max vote weight for the Governing Token mint at the time Proposal was decided
It's used to show correct vote results for historical proposals in cases when the mint supply or max weight source changed
after vote was completed.

fields.name: vote_threshold
docs: The vote threshold percentage at the time Proposal was decided
It's used to show correct vote results for historical proposals in cases when the threshold
was changed for governance config after vote was completed.

fields.name: name
docs: Proposal name

fields.name: description_link
docs: Link to proposal's description
Governance Proposal

accounts.name: SignatoryRecordV1

fields.name: account_type
docs: Governance account type

fields.name: proposal
docs: Proposal the signatory is assigned for

fields.name: signatory
docs: The account of the signatory who can sign off the proposal

fields.name: signed_off
docs: Indicates whether the signatory signed off the proposal
Account PDA seeds: ['governance', proposal, signatory]

accounts.name: ProposalInstructionV1

fields.name: account_type
docs: Governance Account type

fields.name: proposal
docs: The Proposal the instruction belongs to

fields.name: instruction_index
docs: Unique instruction index within it's parent Proposal

fields.name: hold_up_time
docs: Minimum waiting time in seconds for the  instruction to be executed once proposal is voted on

fields.name: instruction
docs: Instruction to execute
The instruction will be signed by Governance PDA the Proposal belongs to
For example for ProgramGovernance the instruction to upgrade program will be signed by ProgramGovernance PDA

fields.name: executed_at
docs: Executed at flag

fields.name: execution_status
docs: Instruction execution status
Proposal instruction V1

accounts.name: VoteRecordV1

fields.name: account_type
docs: Governance account type

fields.name: proposal
docs: Proposal account

fields.name: governing_token_owner
docs: The user who casted this vote
This is the Governing Token Owner who deposited governing tokens into the Realm

fields.name: is_relinquished
docs: Indicates whether the vote was relinquished by voter

fields.name: vote_weight
docs: Voter's vote: Yes/No and amount
Proposal VoteRecord

accounts.name: NativeTreasury
docs: Treasury account
The account has no data and can be used as a payer for instruction signed by Governance PDAs or as a native SOL treasury

accounts.name: ProgramMetadata

fields.name: account_type
docs: Governance account type

fields.name: updated_at
docs: The slot when the metadata was captured

fields.name: version
docs: The version of the program
Max 11 characters XXX.YYY.ZZZ

fields.name: reserved
docs: Reserved
Program metadata account. It stores information about the particular SPL-Governance program instance

accounts.name: OptionVoteResult

variants.name: None
docs: Vote on the option is not resolved yet

variants.name: Succeeded
docs: Vote on the option is completed and the option passed

variants.name: Defeated
docs: Vote on the option is completed and the option was defeated
Proposal option vote result

accounts.name: ProposalOption

fields.name: label
docs: Option label

fields.name: vote_weight
docs: Vote weight for the option

fields.name: vote_result
docs: Vote result for the option

fields.name: transactions_executed_count
docs: The number of the transactions already executed

fields.name: transactions_count
docs: The number of transactions included in the option

fields.name: transactions_next_index
docs: The index of the the next transaction to be added
Proposal Option

accounts.name: VoteType

variants.name: SingleChoice
docs: Single choice vote with mutually exclusive choices
In the SingeChoice mode there can ever be a single winner
If multiple options score the same highest vote then the Proposal is not resolved and considered as Failed
Note: Yes/No vote is a single choice (Yes) vote with the deny option (No)
Proposal vote type

accounts.name: ProposalV2

fields.name: account_type
docs: Governance account type

fields.name: governance
docs: Governance account the Proposal belongs to

fields.name: governing_token_mint
docs: Indicates which Governing Token is used to vote on the Proposal
Whether the general Community token owners or the Council tokens owners vote on this Proposal

fields.name: state
docs: Current proposal state

fields.name: token_owner_record
docs: TODO: add state_at timestamp to have single field to filter recent proposals in the UI
The TokenOwnerRecord representing the user who created and owns this Proposal

fields.name: signatories_count
docs: The number of signatories assigned to the Proposal

fields.name: signatories_signed_off_count
docs: The number of signatories who already signed

fields.name: vote_type
docs: Vote type

fields.name: options
docs: Proposal options

fields.name: deny_vote_weight
docs: The total weight of the Proposal rejection votes
If the proposal has no deny option then the weight is None
Only proposals with the deny option can have executable instructions attached to them
Without the deny option a proposal is only non executable survey

fields.name: reserved1
docs: Reserved space for future versions
This field is a leftover from unused veto_vote_weight: Option<u64>

fields.name: abstain_vote_weight
docs: The total weight of  votes
Note: Abstain is not supported in the current version

fields.name: start_voting_at
docs: Optional start time if the Proposal should not enter voting state immediately after being signed off
Note: start_at is not supported in the current version

fields.name: draft_at
docs: When the Proposal was created and entered Draft state

fields.name: signing_off_at
docs: When Signatories started signing off the Proposal

fields.name: voting_at
docs: When the Proposal began voting as UnixTimestamp

fields.name: voting_at_slot
docs: When the Proposal began voting as Slot
Note: The slot is not currently used but the exact slot is going to be required to support snapshot based vote weights

fields.name: voting_completed_at
docs: When the Proposal ended voting and entered either Succeeded or Defeated

fields.name: executing_at
docs: When the Proposal entered Executing state

fields.name: closed_at
docs: When the Proposal entered final state Completed or Cancelled and was closed

fields.name: execution_flags
docs: Instruction execution flag for ordered and transactional instructions
Note: This field is not used in the current version

fields.name: max_vote_weight
docs: The max vote weight for the Governing Token mint at the time Proposal was decided
It's used to show correct vote results for historical proposals in cases when the mint supply or max weight source changed
after vote was completed.

fields.name: max_voting_time
docs: Max voting time for the proposal if different from parent Governance  (only higher value possible)
Note: This field is not used in the current version

fields.name: vote_threshold
docs: The vote threshold at the time Proposal was decided
It's used to show correct vote results for historical proposals in cases when the threshold
was changed for governance config after vote was completed.
TODO: Use this field to override the threshold from parent Governance (only higher value possible)

fields.name: reserved
docs: Reserved space for future versions

fields.name: name
docs: Proposal name

fields.name: description_link
docs: Link to proposal's description

fields.name: veto_vote_weight
docs: The total weight of Veto votes
Governance Proposal

accounts.name: ProposalTransactionV2

fields.name: account_type
docs: Governance Account type

fields.name: proposal
docs: The Proposal the instruction belongs to

fields.name: option_index
docs: The option index the instruction belongs to

fields.name: transaction_index
docs: Unique transaction index within it's parent Proposal

fields.name: hold_up_time
docs: Minimum waiting time in seconds for the  instruction to be executed once proposal is voted on

fields.name: instructions
docs: Instructions to execute
The instructions will be signed by Governance PDA the Proposal belongs to
For example for ProgramGovernance the instruction to upgrade program will be signed by ProgramGovernance PDA
All instructions will be executed within a single transaction

fields.name: executed_at
docs: Executed at flag

fields.name: execution_status
docs: Instruction execution status

fields.name: reserved_v2
docs: Reserved space for versions v2 and onwards
Note: This space won't be available to v1 accounts until runtime supports resizing
Account for an instruction to be executed for Proposal

fields.name: account_type

fields.name: community_mint
docs: Community mint

fields.name: config
docs: Configuration of the Realm

fields.name: reserved
docs: Reserved space for future versions

fields.name: voting_proposal_count
docs: The number of proposals in voting state in the Realm

fields.name: authority
docs: Realm authority. The authority must sign transactions which update the realm config
The authority should be transferred to Realm Governance to make the Realm self governed through proposals

fields.name: name
docs: Governance Realm name

fields.name: reserved_v2
docs: Reserved space for versions v2 and onwards
Note: This space won't be available to v1 accounts until runtime supports resizing

Account PDA seeds" ['governance', name]

fields.name: community_voter_weight_addin

Note: This field is not implemented in the current version

fields.name: council_voter_weight_addin
docs: Addin providing voter weights for council token
Note: This field is not implemented in the current version

fields.name: council_max_vote_weight_addin
docs: Addin providing max vote weight for council token
Note: This field is not implemented in the current version

RealmConfig account
The account is an optional extension to RealmConfig stored on Realm account

accounts.name: SignatoryRecordV2

fields.name: account_type
docs: Governance account type

fields.name: signatory
docs: The account of the signatory who can sign off the proposal

Note: This space won't be available to v1 accounts until runtime supports resizing

accounts.name: TokenOwnerRecordV2

fields.name: account_type
docs: Governance account type

fields.name: realm
docs: The Realm the TokenOwnerRecord belongs to

fields.name: governing_token_mint
docs: Governing Token Mint the TokenOwnerRecord holds deposit for

fields.name: governing_token_owner
docs: The owner (either single or multisig) of the deposited governing SPL Tokens
This is who can authorize a withdrawal of the tokens

fields.name: governing_token_deposit_amount
docs: The amount of governing tokens deposited into the Realm
This amount is the voter weight used when voting on proposals

fields.name: unrelinquished_votes_count
docs: The number of votes cast by TokenOwner but not relinquished yet
Every time a vote is cast this number is increased and it's always decreased when relinquishing a vote regardless of the vote state

fields.name: total_votes_count
docs: The total number of votes cast by the TokenOwner
If TokenOwner withdraws vote while voting is still in progress total_votes_count is decreased  and the vote doesn't count towards the total

fields.name: outstanding_proposal_count
docs: The number of outstanding proposals the TokenOwner currently owns
The count is increased when TokenOwner creates a proposal
and decreased  once it's either voted on (Succeeded or Defeated) or Cancelled
By default it's restricted to 1 outstanding Proposal per token owner

fields.name: reserved
docs: Reserved space for future versions

fields.name: governance_delegate
docs: A single account that is allowed to operate governance with the deposited governing tokens
It can be delegated to by the governing_token_owner or current governance_delegate

fields.name: reserved_v2
docs: Reserved space for versions v2 and onwards
Note: This space won't be available to v1 accounts until runtime supports resizing
Governance Token Owner Record
Account PDA seeds: ['governance', realm, token_mint, token_owner ]

accounts.name: VoteRecordV2

fields.name: account_type
docs: Governance account type

fields.name: proposal
docs: Proposal account

fields.name: governing_token_owner
docs: The user who casted this vote
This is the Governing Token Owner who deposited governing tokens into the Realm

fields.name: is_relinquished
docs: Indicates whether the vote was relinquished by voter

fields.name: voter_weight
docs: The weight of the user casting the vote

fields.name: vote
docs: Voter's vote

fields.name: reserved_v2
docs: Reserved space for versions v2 and onwards
Note: This space won't be available to v1 accounts until runtime supports resizing
Proposal VoteRecord

types.name: GovernanceConfig

fields.name: community_vote_threshold
docs: The type of the vote threshold used for community vote
Note: In the current version only YesVotePercentage and Disabled thresholds are supported

fields.name: min_community_weight_to_create_proposal
docs: Minimum community weight a governance token owner must possess to be able to create a proposal

fields.name: min_transaction_hold_up_time
docs: Minimum waiting time in seconds for a transaction to be executed after proposal is voted on

fields.name: max_voting_time
docs: Time limit in seconds for proposal to be open for voting

fields.name: vote_tipping
docs: Conditions under which a vote will complete early

fields.name: council_vote_threshold
docs: The type of the vote threshold used for council vote
Note: In the current version only YesVotePercentage and Disabled thresholds are supported

fields.name: council_veto_vote_threshold
docs: The threshold for Council Veto votes

fields.name: min_council_weight_to_create_proposal
docs: Minimum council weight a governance token owner must possess to be able to create a proposal
Governance config

types.name: InstructionData

fields.name: program_id
docs: Pubkey of the instruction processor that executes this instruction

fields.name: accounts
docs: Metadata for what accounts should be passed to the instruction processor

fields.name: data
docs: Opaque data passed to the instruction processor
InstructionData wrapper. It can be removed once Borsh serialization for Instruction is supported in the SDK

types.name: SetRealmAuthorityAction

variants.name: SetUnchecked
docs: Sets realm authority without any checks
Uncheck option allows to set the realm authority to non governance accounts

variants.name: SetChecked
docs: Sets realm authority and checks the new new authority is one of the realm's governances
Note: This is not a security feature because governance creation is only gated with min_community_weight_to_create_governance
The check is done to prevent scenarios where the authority could be accidentally set to a wrong or none existing account

variants.name: Remove
docs: Removes realm authority
SetRealmAuthority instruction action

types.name: AccountMetaData

fields.name: pubkey
docs: An account's public key

fields.name: is_signer
docs: True if an Instruction requires a Transaction signature matching `pubkey`.

fields.name: is_writable
docs: True if the `pubkey` can be loaded as a read-write account.
Account metadata used to define Instructions

types.name: RealmConfigArgs

fields.name: use_council_mint
docs: Indicates whether council_mint should be used
If yes then council_mint account must also be passed to the instruction

fields.name: min_community_weight_to_create_governance
docs: Min number of community tokens required to create a governance

fields.name: community_mint_max_vote_weight_source
docs: The source used for community mint max vote weight source

fields.name: use_community_voter_weight_addin
docs: Indicates whether an external addin program should be used to provide community voters weights
If yes then the voters weight program account must be passed to the instruction

fields.name: use_max_community_voter_weight_addin
docs: Indicates whether an external addin program should be used to provide max voters weight for the community mint
If yes then the max voter weight program account must be passed to the instruction
Realm Config instruction args

types.name: RealmConfig

fields.name: use_community_voter_weight_addin
docs: Indicates whether an external addin program should be used to provide voters weights for the community mint

fields.name: use_max_community_voter_weight_addin
docs: Indicates whether an external addin program should be used to provide max voter weight for the community mint

fields.name: reserved
docs: Reserved space for future versions

fields.name: min_community_weight_to_create_governance
docs: Min number of voter's community weight required to create a governance

fields.name: community_mint_max_vote_weight_source
docs: The source used for community mint max vote weight source

fields.name: council_mint
docs: Optional council mint
Realm Config defining Realm parameters.

types.name: VoteChoice

fields.name: rank
docs: The rank given to the choice by voter
Note: The filed is not used in the current version

fields.name: weight_percentage
docs: The voter's weight percentage given by the voter to the choice
Voter choice for a proposal option
In the current version only 1) Single choice and 2) Multiple choices proposals are supported
In the future versions we can add support for 1) Quadratic voting, 2) Ranked choice voting and 3) Weighted voting

types.name: Vote

fields.name: F0
docs: Vote approving choices

variants.name: Deny
docs: Vote rejecting proposal

variants.name: Abstain
docs: Declare indifference to proposal
Note: Not supported in the current version

variants.name: Veto
docs: Veto proposal
User's vote

types.name: VoteKind

variants.name: Electorate
docs: Electorate vote is cast by the voting population identified by governing_token_mint
Approve, Deny and Abstain votes are Electorate votes

variants.name: Veto
docs: Vote cast by the opposite voting population to the Electorate identified by governing_token_mint
VoteKind defines the type of the vote being cast

types.name: VoteThreshold

fields.name: F0
docs: Voting threshold of Yes votes in % required to tip the vote (Approval Quorum)
It's the percentage of tokens out of the entire pool of governance tokens eligible to vote
Note: If the threshold is below or equal to 50% then an even split of votes ex: 50:50 or 40:40 is always resolved as Defeated
In other words a '+1 vote' tie breaker is always required to have a successful vote

fields.name: F0
docs: The minimum number of votes in % out of the entire pool of governance tokens eligible to vote
which must be cast for the vote to be valid
Once the quorum is achieved a simple majority (50%+1) of Yes votes is required for the vote to succeed
Note: Quorum is not implemented in the current version

variants.name: Disabled
docs: Disabled vote threshold indicates the given voting population (community or council) is not allowed to vote
on proposals for the given Governance
The type of the vote threshold used to resolve a vote on a Proposal
Note: In the current version only YesVotePercentage and Disabled thresholds are supported

types.name: MintMaxVoteWeightSource

fields.name: F0
docs: Fraction (10^10 precision) of the governing mint supply is used as max vote weight
The default is 100% (10^10) to use all available mint supply for voting

fields.name: F0
docs: Absolute value, irrelevant of the actual mint supply, is used as max vote weight
Note: this option is not implemented in the current version
The source of max vote weight used for voting
Values below 100% mint supply can be used when the governing token is fully minted but not distributed yet

types.name: VoteWeightV1

fields.name: F0
docs: Yes vote

fields.name: F0
docs: No vote
Vote  with number of votes

errors.msg: Owner doesn't have enough governing tokens to create Proposal

errors.msg: Can't execute transaction within its hold up time
errors.name: CannotExecuteTransactionWithinHoldUpTime

errors.msg: Transaction hold up time is below the min specified by Governance
errors.name: TransactionHoldUpTimeBelowRequiredMin

errors.msg: Transaction at the given index for the Proposal already exists
errors.name: TransactionAlreadyExists

errors.msg: Can't finalize vote. Voting still in progress
errors.name: CannotFinalizeVotingInProgress

errors.msg: Proposal does not belong to the given Governance
errors.name: InvalidGovernanceForProposal

errors.msg: Proposal does not belong to given Governing Mint
errors.name: InvalidGoverningMintForProposal

errors.msg: Current mint authority must sign transaction
errors.name: MintAuthorityMustSign

errors.msg: Token mint account data is invalid
errors.name: SplTokenInvalidMintAccountData

errors.msg: Token Mint account is not initialized
errors.name: SplTokenMintNotInitialized

errors.msg: Provided upgrade authority doesn't match current program upgrade authority
errors.name: InvalidUpgradeAuthority

errors.msg: Current program upgrade authority must sign transaction
errors.name: UpgradeAuthorityMustSign

errors.msg: Current token owner must sign transaction
errors.name: TokenOwnerMustSign

errors.msg: Realm council mint change is not supported
errors.name: RealmCouncilMintChangeIsNotSupported

errors.msg: Not supported mint max vote weight source
errors.name: MintMaxVoteWeightSourceNotSupported

errors.msg: Invalid max vote weight supply fraction
errors.name: InvalidMaxVoteWeightSupplyFraction

errors.msg: Owner doesn't have enough governing tokens to create Governance
errors.name: NotEnoughTokensToCreateGovernance

errors.msg: All proposals must be finalized to withdraw governing tokens
errors.name: AllProposalsMustBeFinalisedToWithdrawGoverningTokens

errors.msg: At least one VoteThreshold is required
errors.name: AtLeastOneVoteThresholdRequired
